name.description: Name of the experiment. It should be a unique name if you want to run a new experiment. If you enable auto resume, the experiment with this name will be resumed instead of starting a new training run.

scale.description: Scale of the model. Most architectures support a scale of 1, 2, 3, 4, or 8. A scale of 1 can be used for restoration models that don't change the resolution of the input image. A scale of 2 means the width and height of the input image are doubled, so a 640x480 input will be upscaled to 1280x960.

num_gpu.description: The number of GPUs to use for training, if using multiple GPUs.

network_d.description: The options for the discriminator model.

network_ae.description: The options for the autoencoder model.

manual_seed.description: Random seed for training, useful for removing randomness when testing the effect of different settings.

deterministic.description: Enables torch.use_deterministic_algorithms. Slows down training, only use when reproducibility is critical.

use_amp.description: Speed up training and reduce VRAM usage. NVIDIA only.

amp_bf16.description: Use bf16 instead of fp16 for AMP, RTX 3000 series or newer only. Only recommended if fp16 doesn't work.

use_channels_last.description: Enable channels last memory format while using AMP. Reduces VRAM and speeds up training for most architectures, but some architectures are slower with channels last.

use_compile.description: Enable torch.compile for the generator model, which takes time on startup to compile the model, but can speed up training after the model is compiled. However, compilation must be redone when starting training each time, as the compiled model is not saved, so for models that take too long to compile it may not worth it.

detect_anomaly.description: Whether or not to enable anomaly detection, which can be useful for debugging NaNs that occur during training. Has a significant performance hit and should be disabled when not debugging.

high_order_degradation.description: Whether or not to enable OTF (on the fly) degradations, which generates LRs on the fly.

high_order_degradations_debug.description: Whether or not to enable debugging for OTF, which saves the OTF generated LR images so they can be inspected to view the effect of different OTF settings.

high_order_degradations_debug_limit.description: The maximum number of OTF images to save when debugging is enabled.

dataroot_lq_prob.description: Probability of using paired LR data instead of OTF LR data.

lq_usm.description: Whether to enable unsharp mask on the LQ image.

lq_usm_radius_range.description: For the unsharp mask of the LQ image, use a radius randomly selected from this range.

blur_prob.description: Probability of applying the first blur to the LQ, between 0 and 1.

resize_prob.description: List of 3 probabilities for the first resize which should add up to 1: the probability of upscaling, the probability of downscaling, and the probability of no resize.

resize_mode_list.description: List of possible resize modes to use for the first resize.

resize_mode_prob.description: List of probabilities for the first resize of selecting the corresponding resize mode in `resize_mode_list`.

resize_range.description: The resize range for the first resize, in the format `[min_resize, max_resize]`.

gaussian_noise_prob.description: The probability of applying the first gaussian noise to the LQ, between 0 and 1.

jpeg_prob.description: The probability of applying the first JPEG degradation to the LQ, between 0 and 1.

jpeg_range.description: The range of JPEG quality to apply for the first JPEG degradation, in the format `[min_quality, max_quality]`.

blur_prob2.description: Probability of applying the second blur to the LQ, between 0 and 1.

resize_prob2.description: List of 3 probabilities for the second resize which should add up to 1: the probability of upscaling, the probability of downscaling, and the probability of no resize.

resize_mode_list2.description: List of possible resize modes to use for the second resize.

resize_mode_prob2.description: List of probabilities for the second resize of selecting the corresponding resize mode in `resize_mode_list2`.

resize_range2.description: The resize range for the second resize, in the format `[min_resize, max_resize]`.

gaussian_noise_prob2.description: The probability of applying the second gaussian noise to the LQ, between 0 and 1.

jpeg_prob2.description: The probability of applying the second JPEG degradation to the LQ, between 0 and 1.

jpeg_range2.description: The range of JPEG quality to apply for the second JPEG degradation, in the format `[min_quality, max_quality]`.

resize_mode_list3.description: List of possible resize modes to use for the final resize.

resize_mode_prob3.description: List of probabilities for the final resize of selecting the corresponding resize mode in `resize_mode_list3`.

queue_size.description: Queue size for OTF processing, must be a multiple of `batch_size_per_gpu`.

pretrain_network_g.description: Path to the pretrain model for the generator. `pth` and `safetensors` formats are supported.

strict_load_g.description: Whether to load the pretrain model for the generator in strict mode. It should be enabled in most cases, unless you want to partially load a pretrain of a different scale or with slightly different hyperparameters.

pretrain_network_d.description: Path to the pretrain model for the discriminator. `pth` and `safetensors` formats are supported.

strict_load_d.description: Whether to load the pretrain model for the discriminator in strict mode. It should be enabled in most cases.

pretrain_network_ae.description: Path to the pretrain model for the autoencoder. `pth` and `safetensors` formats are supported.

pretrain_network_ae_decoder.description: Path to the pretrain model for the decoder of the autoencoder. `pth` and `safetensors` formats are supported.

name.description: Name of the dataset. It should be unique compared to other datasets in this config, but the exact name isn't very important.

type.description: The type of dataset to use.

num_worker_per_gpu.description: Number of subprocesses to use for data loading with PyTorch dataloader.

batch_size_per_gpu.description: Increasing stabilizes training but going too high can cause issues. Use multiple of 8 for best performance with AMP. A higher batch size, like 32 or 64 is more important when training from scratch, while smaller batches like 8 can be used when training with a quality pretrain model.

accum_iter.description: Using values larger than 1 simulates higher batch size by trading performance for reduced VRAM usage. If accum_iter = 4 and batch_size_per_gpu = 6 then effective batch size = 4 * 6 = 24 but performance may be as much as 4 times as slow.

lq_size.description: During training, a square of this size is cropped from LR images. Larger is usually better but uses more VRAM. Previously gt_size, use lq_size = gt_size / scale to convert. Use multiple of 8 for best performance with AMP.

dataset_enlarge_ratio.description: Increase if the dataset is less than 1000 images to avoid slowdowns. Auto will automatically enlarge small datasets only.

clip_size.description: Number of frames per clip in `PairedVideoDataset`. Must match the `clip_size` option for video generator networks such as `tscunet`.

dataroot_gt.description: Path to the HR (high res) images in your training dataset. Specify one or multiple folders, separated by commas.

dataroot_lq.description: Path to the LR (low res) images in your training dataset. Specify one or multiple folders, separated by commas.

filename_tmpl.description: Filename template to use for LR images. Commonly used values might be `{}x2` or `{}x4`, which should be used if the LR dataset filename is in the format filename.png while the LR dataset filename is in the format `filename_x2.png` or `filename_x4.png`. This is common on some research datasets such as DIV2K or DF2K.

total_iter.description: The total number of iterations to train.

adaptive_d.description: Whether the discriminator updates adaptively. That is, discriminator updates are paused whenever the generator falls behind the discriminator (whenever smoothed l_g_gan increases). Can mitigate GAN collapse by preventing the discriminator from overpowering the generator.

optim_g.description: The optimizer to use for the generator model.

ema_decay.description: The decay factor to use for EMA (exponential moving average). Set to 0 to disable EMA.

ema_switch_iter.description: How often to switch EMA model to online model, in iterations. Set to 0 to disable.

grad_clip.description: Whether or not to enable gradient clipping, which can improve stability when using higher learning rates, but can also cause issues in some situations.

warmup_iter.description: Gradually ramp up learning rates until this iteration, to stabilize early training. Use -1 to disable.

scheduler.description: Options for the optimizer scheduler. If there are multiple optimizers, both will use the same scheduler options.

optim_d.description: The optimizer to use for the discriminator model.

optim_ae.description: The optimizer to use for the autoencoder model.

losses.description: The list of loss functions to optimize.

use_moa.description: Whether to enable mixture of augmentations, which augments the dataset on the fly to create more variety and help the model generalize.

moa_augs.description: The list of augmentations to choose from, only one is selected per iteration.

moa_probs.description: The probability each augmentation in moa_augs will be applied. Total should add up to 1.

moa_debug.description: Save images before and after augment to debug/moa folder inside of the root training directory.

moa_debug_limit.description: The max number of iterations to save augmentation images for.

val_enabled.description: Whether to enable validations. If disabled, all validation settings below are ignored.

save_img.description: Whether to save the validation images during validation, in the experiments/<name>/visualization folder.

tile_size.description: Tile size of input to use during validation, reduce VRAM usage but slower inference. 0 to disable.

tile_overlap.description: Tile overlap to use during validation, larger is slower but reduces tile seams.

val_freq.description: How often to run validations, in iterations.

suffix.description: Optional suffix to append to saved filenames.

metrics_enabled.description: Whether to run metrics calculations during validation.

print_freq.description: How often to print logs to the console, in iterations.

save_checkpoint_freq.description: How often to save model checkpoints and training states, in iterations.

use_tb_logger.description: Whether or not to enable TensorBoard logging.
